reviews.text: Phenomenal Indian food. Ive had a ton of indian food in NYC and Yonkers and this place is the best Ive had by far. If you do not regularly eat spicy food, stick with mild as the spicy curry flavors are insanely spicy, I was dribbling snot and crying through my meal but it was so good that I couldn't stop myself from eating the whole bowl of curry. All the food was really really good, I tried everyone else curries and and sides they were all really great. This is my new favorite spot in Middletown, I hope they keep up the quality!
Spicy means spicy! Very good food.

I had a great experience at Dosa Grill! The food was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly spiced. The staff was friendly, and the service was quick. The restaurant was clean and had a nice, welcoming vibe. Definitely a great spot for authentic Indian food ‚Äî I‚Äôll be coming back again soon!
Such a warm welcoming, absolutely loved the food and the way they responded is very much appreciated.
Food, receiving and evrything looks perfect, Aussum
It was good experience food was good service was so good
Dosa was so good excellent service

My husband and I went to Dosa Grill for lunch buffet on Sunday.  The young man who served us, Yash, was so kind and professional.  The food was authentic, bursting with spicy flavors, as should be the case.  They didn't skimp on spices or quality ingredients- the meats were also very fresh- and most importantly, they didn't dull down the flavors to cater to the bland palate.  If you're looking for quality, real, authentic Indian food in the otherwise ethnic food desert of Orange County, give Dosa Grill a try.

Food seems to be made of good quality ingredients and the service is pleasant and attentive. We went twice in one week, and the hubby wants to go on a Wednesday evening for the buffet, which looks like it will provide quite a variety of dishes. This place is a nice addition to the Middletown culinary scene ‚Äî definitely worth checking out!

My Server Yash was absolutely outstanding.
He was so kind,personable,helpful,and knowledgeable.
He‚Äôs just a sweet ,down-to-earth, clean, good looking young man.
The food and the atmosphere was great.
I will help spread the word for this new restaurant establishment.
Thank you and good luck to you all.
Jerry,

We went for my husbands birthday dinner. The staff was able to accommodate 13 people within a few minutes. It was a wonderful experience. Fresh ingredients, flavorful dishes, friendly staff, and a pleasant atmosphere. We ate the buffet and will definitely come back for the dosas.
Its was very good experience food was very good  excellent service

This was one of the best Indian buffets we‚Äôve had in a long time! The buffet selection was impressive, with a great balance of classic favorites and unique dishes. Everything was seasoned perfectly, with great flavors and a little heat without being overpowering. The staff were friendly, attentive, and made sure everything stayed replenished and hot. Highly recommend for anyone who loves authentic, well-prepared Indian food.
I was hungry and it was close. I ordered the vegetarian assorted platter and salmon biryani with peshawari naan

Upon walking in, you are welcomed to the flavors of Jalandhar and Charda Punjab. Ritesh was a very hospitable server and the food was delicious.

Chicken tikka was grilled to perfection, the lamb chops were succulent, and mouthwateringly savory, and most importantly the Mysore Dosa for dinner was delicious!! I am coming back here for the dinner service again for sure. Bring lots of friends as well!!
top notch food top notch service amazing atmosphere you guys should try them out

The big take away from the buffet is that the flavor is great. Everything was spiced well and the byriani was delicious !!
The rice pudding is broken rice with so much great anis√© and black cardamom flavor it was the best I‚Äôve ever had. It was my first time having dosa, it fell apart when I picked it up,  or sure if that‚Äôs normal as I‚Äôve never had it but the potato chili filling was spicy and very good.

A few suggestions, get some music in there. Indian music is so beautiful and would complement the atmosphere. The buffet food was not hot, more like room temp. If the food was hot and the music was on I‚Äôd say this place was perfect. I can‚Äôt wait to go back!!

Amazing food at amazing prices
Rude over the phone. I called to find the location.  The worker couldn't understand English so he hanged the phone up on me.

I recently visited Dosa Grill, and it was an absolutely delightful experience! The customer service was excellent ‚Äî the staff was very welcoming, attentive, and made sure we had everything we needed throughout our meal.

The South Indian food was simply amazing! Every dish was full of authentic flavors, perfectly spiced, and freshly prepared. The dosas were crisp and delicious, and the sambar and chutneys complemented them beautifully.

Overall, Dosa Grill offers a warm atmosphere, fantastic service, and some of the best South Indian cuisine I‚Äôve ever had. Highly recommended for anyone craving authentic flavors and a great dining experience! üåü

This place is family friendly, and can accommodate large parties no problem! I recommend the salmon and the lamb chop both was so good! They serve the food fresh on a hot plate!! You can still see the steam coming off the food it‚Äôs so hot and fresh love that! Definitely coming back!! Thank you for taking the time to read this!!
staff was very friendly food was very good highly recommended price is very good

Yesterday Me and my friend stop by location to have Indian food which has got wonderful experience in taste and friendly hospitality personal overall 100/100 satisfied in DosaGrill Middletown Their plain dosa and butter masala dosa was tasty  even the North Indian food was taste ful and we tried their vegetable biryani was yummy I am so happy and waiting to be come back again to dine in this restaurant Thanks for friendly staff Yash and Vicky and great chef
I was go for the buffet was very good staff was very friendly

Visited this newly opened dosa spot on their second day. We were seated right away, and though they were still setting up a few things, the decor was cute and welcoming.

We tried the mango lassi, which was a bit on the thick side. The dosa itself wasn‚Äôt quite as crispy as expected and slightly oily, and the sambhar felt more like a daal than a traditional sambhar. On the other hand, the fish fry was absolutely delicious and the Indo-Chinese dishes were also very flavorful.

It was nice to see they have both a Punjabi and a South Indian chef, which makes for an interesting and varied menu. Service was good, though they could definitely benefit from setting up some music to enhance the ambience.

This new Indian restaurant is a welcome addition to the Middletown area.

We ordered the vegetable samosas and lamb samosas to start.  The minced lamb was flavorful (highly recommended).

As our main dishes, we ordered the okra with rice and a butter masala dosa. Both dishes were very tasty.

The rice pudding was very fresh.

Our complements to the chef.

Our server Yash was very attentive and informative.

This place is a definite hit.
